# Git

version control system

# commands

  • Initializing repository

    git init

  • add changes (to a staging area)

    git add [file1.ext]
git add [file2.ext]

    or add all :

    git add .

  • discard changes in working directory or the staging area

    git reset --hard

  • committing changes

    git commit -m "commit message"

  • branches

    • show

      git branch

    • create

      git branch [branch.name]

    • merge

    git merge master [branch.name]

  • compare changes

    • working directory / staging area

      git diff

    • staging area / repository (commit)

      git diff --staged

    • between commits

      git diff [commit1.id] [commit2.id]

  • show commits

    git log
git log --stat
git log --oneline
git log --graph
git log --graph --oneline [branch1] [branch2]

  • change version (working directory)

    git checkout [commit.id]
git checkout [branch.name]
git checkout master

  • show status

    git status

  • adding a remote

    • show

      git remote

    • add

      git remote add origin [repository.url]

    • sync remote from local repository

      git push origin [branch.name]
git push origin master

#update all branches
git push -u --all origin

    • sync local repository from remote

      git fetch
git merge master origin/master

# or
git pull origin master

  • tag

    git tag [tag.name]
git push origin --tags

# configuration

  • change default text editor

    git config --global core.editor "C:\Microsoft VS Code\Code.exe -n -w"

# useful link

Git cheat sheet
